Package org.jtrim2.taskgraph.basic

Class CollectingTaskGraphBuilder

java.lang.Object
org.jtrim2.taskgraph.basic.CollectingTaskGraphBuilder
All Implemented Interfaces:
TaskGraphBuilder
public final class CollectingTaskGraphBuilder extends Object implements TaskGraphBuilder
Defines a simple implementation of TaskGraphBuilder which collects the added task node keys and simply passes them to a given TaskGraphExecutorFactory. Once graph building is requested, the graph is built with its task nodes already aware of their input. That is, the nodes of the graph will be translated into TaskNode instances.

Thread safety

The methods of this class may not be used by multiple threads concurrently, unless otherwise noted.

Synchronization transparency

The methods of this class are not synchronization transparent in general.
See Also:
  • CollectingTaskGraphDefConfigurer
  • RestrictableTaskGraphExecutor

  • Constructor Details

    • CollectingTaskGraphBuilder

      public CollectingTaskGraphBuilder(Collection<? extends TaskFactoryConfig<?,?>> configs, TaskGraphExecutorFactory executorFactory)
      Creates a new CollectingTaskGraphBuilder with the given task factory definitions and TaskGraphExecutorFactory.
      Parameters:
      configs - the task factory definitions used to create the task nodes. This argument cannot be null and cannot contain null elements.
      executorFactory - the TaskGraphExecutorFactory used to create the TaskGraphExecutor actually executing the task graph. This argument cannot be null.

  • Method Details

    • addNode

      public void addNode(TaskNodeKey<?,?> nodeKey)
      Adds a node to the task execution graph. Adding a node will force the execution framework to at least execute that node.

      It is allowed to call addNode concurrently with another addNode call. However, the addNode method may not be called concurrently with any other method of this interface.

      Specified by:
      addNode in interface TaskGraphBuilder
      Parameters:
      nodeKey - the TaskNodeKey identifying the task node to be created. The task node key must not be added multiple times and there must be a task node factory able to create nodes based on this key. This argument cannot be null.

    • properties

      public TaskGraphBuilderProperties.Builder properties()
      Returns the properties used when building the task graph. The properties must be set before calling the buildGraph method.
      Specified by:
      properties in interface TaskGraphBuilder
      Returns:
      the properties used when building the task graph. This method never returns null.

    • buildGraph

      public CompletionStage<TaskGraphExecutor> buildGraph(CancellationToken cancelToken)
      Starts building a task graph and will notify the returned CompletionStage once the graph is built and is ready to be executed.

      Adding further nodes after calling this method does not affect the TaskGraphExecutor to be created.

      Specified by:
      buildGraph in interface TaskGraphBuilder
      Parameters:
      cancelToken - the CancellationToken which can be used to cancel the building of the task graph. The framework will make a best effort to cancel the building of the task graph. However, there is no guarantee that cancellation request will be fulfilled. If cancellation succeeds, the CompletionStage will complete exceptionally with an OperationCanceledException.
      Returns:
      the CompletionStage which can be used to receive the TaskGraphExecutor and actually start the task graph execution. This method never returns null.
